page.title: 01SOUTH LORN
page.content: On the main road leaving the town there us the Oban Woollen Mill where they make up skirts, jumpers, coats etc. with a small museum at the back. On the right of the main road are houses all the way out to a hotel and on the left there are a couple of Hostels and a school for disabled children. Then there is the Soroba council estate and a small private estate. On the outskirts of Oban, to the west there is a small cottage hospital. The countryside to the South of Oban is mostly grazing land with some sheep and cattle. It is sparsely populated. The scenery is lovely to look at, with lochs and patches of trees. There are occasional farms, private houses and cottages. As well as this there is a cave where bone of pre-historic man were found recently.
